CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper September 30, 1972, pg. 19, reads: "Superfly's Hog - The customized $23,000.00 Cadillac Eldorado that was driven by Ron O'Neal in the controversial film "Super Fly" was put on display by its owner K. C., pictured on the right in the top photo, last week at the New Pittsburgh Courier offices.  Accompanying K. C. on his whirlwind tour of the city was Nathan Adams who is shown on the left in the top photo.  The movie opens on Wednesday, October 4, at the Stanley Theatre. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Women and men gathered around Cadillac Eldorado car with banner reading: "This car used by Ron O'Neal in Super Fly, Starts Wed., Oct. 4, Stanley Theater, Downtown Pittsburgh," in front of Terminal Building with New Pittsburgh Courier offices, 315 Carson Street, South Side
